{{Infobox CHL season | title = 1996â97 MetJHL season | colour = #007AC2 | colour text = #FFFFFF | league = [[Metro Junior A Hockey League]] | league abr = MetJHL | logo = | duration = '''Regular season'''
1996-09 â 1997-02
'''Playoffs'''
1997-02 â 1997-05 | champions = [[Aurora Tigers]] | no of teams = 16 | commissioner = | prev year = [[1995â96 MetJHL season|1995â96]] | next year = [[1997â98 MetJHL season|1997â98]] }} The '''1996â97 MetJHL [[Season (sports)|season]]''' is the [[List of OJHL seasons|6th]] season of the [[Metro Junior A Hockey League]] (MetJHL). The 16 teams of the Central, Eastern, and Western Divisions competed in a 50-game schedule. The top 12 teams made the playoffs. The winner of the MetJHL playoffs, the [[Aurora Tigers]], could not move into national playdowns as the Metro was not a member of the [[Ontario Hockey Association]]. ==Milestones== *On February 21, 1997, the [[Huntsville-Muskoka Otters|Muskoka Bears']] Ryan Venturelli became the first known goaltender in hockey history to score two goals (both empty net) in a hockey game against the [[Durham Huskies Jr. A|Durham Huskies]] during the [[Metro Junior A Hockey League]] 1996-97 regular season.[http://www.lcshockey.com/issues/LCS65.txt] ==Changes== *League switches from 2 divisions to 3, adding Central Division. *[[Durham Huskies Jr. A|Durham Huskies]], [[Quinte Hawks]], [[Syracuse Jr. Crunch]], and [[Port Hope Buzzards]] join the MetJHL. *Shelburne Hornets become [[Shelburne Wolves]].
